page.title: 14Houses at Dedham
page.content: When entering Dedham Road, a small 19th Century farm house built as a Charity Farm is on the left. Forge Cottage is a modern cottage bungalow built in the late 1970's where the old forge used to be. Further on is the Lodge, a 19th Century house, which is a gatehouse to the Chase of Lawford Hall. Sherbourne and Sherbourne Cottage are next, both are thatched, timber framed 17th Century cottages. Both were originally designed for two families. Sherbourne Cottage was the miller's house. Sherbourne Mill is a red brick Georgian House with a white clapboard watermill and millpond at the front of the house. The watermill is built on the site of earlier mills dating back to Saxon times. Opposite Sherbourne Mill is Mill cottage built in the early 1800's. By Emily Gallifant, 13 years old.
